attributes 'Main-Class': 'yapper.Yapper' // Ensures correct entry point for JAR
* The main class for the Yapper chatbot, which manages task storage, user interactions,
* Initializes data storage, loads existing tasks, and sets up user interaction.
* @param filePath The file path for storing and loading tasks.
* Runs the chatbot, handling user input, executing commands, and managing task persistence.
* The chatbot continues running until the user enters the "bye" command.
scanner.close(); // Ensure scanner is properly closed
* The entry point of the Yapper chatbot application.
* Handles loading and saving of tasks from a data file.
* Constructs a DataStorage instance with the given file path.
* @param filePath The path to the file used for storing task data.
* Loads tasks from the data file.
* If the file does not exist, it is created, and an empty task list is returned.
* @return A TaskList containing the tasks loaded from the file.

* Saves the current list of tasks to the data file.
* If the parent directory does not exist, it is created before writing to the file.

* The {@code Parser} class is responsible for interpreting user commands
* and executing the corresponding actions on the task list.
* Private constructor to prevent instantiation of the {@code Parser} class.
* @param request The user input string containing command and relevant task details.
* @return The command word extracted from the user input.
* Executes the user input request on the provided {@code TaskList}.

*
  • {@code todo} - Adds a new ToDo task.

*
  • {@code deadline} - Adds a new Deadline task.

*
  • {@code event} - Adds a new Event task.

*
  • {@code mark} - Marks a task as completed.

*
  • {@code delete} - Deletes a task from the list.
* If an unsupported command is entered, an error message is displayed.
* @param request The user input command string.
* @param taskList The current list of tasks.
* @return The updated task list after executing the command.
public static TaskList executeCommand (String request, TaskList taskList) {

* Represents a deadline task with a specific date and time.
* Constructs a {@code Deadline} task from the given user request.
* The request must be formatted as: {@code deadline task_name /by yyyy/MM/dd HHmm}.
* @param request The user input containing the task name and deadline details.
* @throws MissingTaskArgs If the required arguments are missing or incorrectly formatted.
String[] splitString = request.split(" /by ", 2); // Ensure correct splitting
throw new MissingTaskArgs("\tHey! I dont quite understand you. Remember for Deadline " +

throw new MissingTaskArgs("\tHey! I dont quite understand you. Remember for Deadline " +
"Give it in this format: command name /by YYYY/MM/DD HHmm");
* Returns a string representation of the deadline task, including the date and time.
* @return A formatted string representing the deadline task.
* Represents an event task with a specific start and end date/time.
* Constructs an {@code Event} task from the given user request.
* The request must be formatted as: {@code event task_name /from YYYY/MM/DD HHmm /to YYYY/MM/DD HHmm}.
* @param request The user input containing the task name, start time, and end time.
* @throws MissingTaskArgs If the required arguments are missing or incorrectly formatted.
throw new MissingTaskArgs("\tHey! I don't quite understand you. Remember for Events " +
"Give it in this format: command name /from {YYYY/MM/DD} {0000} /to {YYYY/MM/DD} {2359}");
* Returns a string representation of the event task, including start and end date/time.
* @return A formatted string representing the event task.
* Represents an abstract task that can be marked as completed or not completed.
* It serves as a base class for different types of tasks.

* Marks the task as not completed.

* Represents a list of tasks that can be manipulated by adding, removing,
* marking, and unmarking tasks. Supports optional printing of operations.
* Activates printing of messages when tasks are added, removed, or modified.
* Deactivates printing of messages when tasks are added, removed, or modified.
* Reverses the order of tasks in the list.
* Adds a task to the task list.
* If printing is enabled, a confirmation message is displayed.

System.out.println("\tGot it. I've added this task:\n\t\t" + newTask);

* Represents a ToDo task, which consists only of a task name without any date or time constraints.
* Constructs a {@code ToDo} task from the given user request.

assertEquals("todo Read a book", taskList.getList().get(0).getUserInput(), "First task should match");
assertEquals("deadline Submit assignment /by 2024/02/05 0000", taskList.getList().get(1).getUserInput(), "Second task should match");
assertEquals(1, taskList.getList().size(), "TaskList should contain 1 task after valid 'todo' command");
assertEquals("todo Buy milk", taskList.getList().get(0).getUserInput(), "Task description should match");
assertEquals(1, taskList.getList().size(), "TaskList should contain 1 task after valid 'deadline' command");
assertEquals("deadline Submit report /by 2024/02/05 0000", taskList.getList().get(0).getUserInput(), "Deadline task should match input");
assertEquals(0, taskList.getList().size(), "TaskList should remain empty for an invalid command");
assertEquals(0, taskList.getList().size(), "TaskList should remain empty for an empty command");
